001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.drivers.providers;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.drivers.base.BaseDriverProvider;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.log.LogUi;
005import io.github.bonigarcia.wdm.WebDriverManager;
006import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
007import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver;
008import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriverService;
009import org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeOptions;
010
011/**
012 * Provides a WebDriver implementation for the Google Chrome browser.
013 *
014 * <p>This class extends {@link BaseDriverProvider} and implements methods to configure,
015 * create, and manage ChromeDriver instances. It also utilizes WebDriverManager
016 * to automatically download the appropriate ChromeDriver version.
017 *
018 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
019 */
020public class ChromeDriverProvider extends BaseDriverProvider<ChromeOptions> {
021
022   /**
023    * Retrieves the type of the driver.
024    *
025    * @return A string representing the driver type, which is "CHROME".
026    */
027   @Override
028   protected String getDriverType() {
029      return "CHROME";
030   }
031
032   /**
033    * Creates a new instance of ChromeOptions, which holds the browser configuration.
034    *
035    * @return A new {@link ChromeOptions} instance.
036    */
037   @Override
038   public ChromeOptions createOptions() {
039      return new ChromeOptions();
040   }
041
042   /**
043    * Creates a new instance of {@link ChromeDriver} using the specified options.
044    *
045    * @param options The ChromeOptions instance containing the browser configurations.
046    * @return A new {@link ChromeDriver} instance.
047    */
048   @Override
049   public WebDriver createDriver(ChromeOptions options) {
050      return new ChromeDriver(ChromeDriverService.createDefaultService(), options);
051   }
052
053   /**
054    * Applies default arguments to the ChromeOptions instance.
055    *
056    * <p>The default arguments help optimize browser execution and enhance stability.
057    *
058    * @param options The {@link ChromeOptions} instance to modify.
059    */
060   @Override
061   public void applyDefaultArguments(ChromeOptions options) {
062      options.addArguments("--disable-gpu", "--no-sandbox", "--remote-allow-origins=*", "--guest");
063   }
064
065   /**
066    * Applies additional arguments to enable headless mode in Chrome.
067    *
068    * <p>Headless mode allows running tests without a visible UI, making execution faster and more efficient in
069    * CI/CD environments.
070    *
071    * @param options The {@link ChromeOptions} instance to modify.
072    */
073   @Override
074   public void applyHeadlessArguments(final ChromeOptions options) {
075      options.addArguments("--headless", "window-size=1920x1080", "--allow-insecure-localhost",
076            "--disable-dev-shm-usage");
077   }
078
079   /**
080    * Downloads the appropriate ChromeDriver version using WebDriverManager.
081    *
082    * <p>If a version is provided, it downloads the specified version.
083    * Otherwise, it automatically downloads the compatible driver version
084    * for the installed Chrome browser.
085    *
086    * @param version The ChromeDriver version to download (optional).
087    */
088   @Override
089   public void downloadDriver(final String version) {
090      if (version == null || version.isEmpty()) {
091         WebDriverManager.chromedriver().setup();
092         LogUi.info("Chrome driver is downloaded with a compatible version for the installed browser");
093      } else {
094         WebDriverManager.chromedriver().driverVersion(version).setup();
095         LogUi.info("Chrome driver is downloaded with version: '{}'", version);
096      }
097   }
098
099}
